There's no other way around it, and this leaves many journalists with a stark choice: do you spend a little bit of extra time on a story and do your due diligence?

item.title: Ron Dellums - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: American Democratic politician who served in the U.S. House of Representatives from 1970 to 1998. After his time in Congress, he served as Mayor of Oakland, California. Before Fame He served in the U.S. Marine Corps from 1954 to 1956 and went on to attend Oakland City College, San Francisco State University, and finally the University of California-Berkeley, where he earned his Master's degree in social work. Trivia He drafted anti-apartheid legislation in Congress in 1972.

item.title: 'Get Rid Of Lions, Tigers From Tormenting Edo People' Okowa Tells Obaseki
item.description: Governor Ifeanyi Okowa of Delta State, just like President Muhammadu Buhari, has admonished Governor Godwin Obaseki of Edo State to be magnanimous and graceful in victory. During a “thank you” visit to the Delta State governor in Asaba on Wednesday, September 23, the governor felicitated with Obaseki who contested and won in the just concluded election in Edo State under the Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, urged him ‘not to allow the lions and the tigers to torment the people again’.

item.title: Revenue collection shortfall forces govt to slash 2019-2020 budget by KSh 131 billion
item.description: - Treasury CS Yattani said the move will help the government avoid making decisions based on false assumptions - The acting exchequer boss added the measure will go along way in helping Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) set achievable targets - KRA, which targets to net about KSh 1.9 trillion this fiscal year, will see its revenue collection target significantly reduced The government has readjusted its 2019-2020 national budget by KSh 131 billion amid fears that the taxman will once again fail to hit its revenue target this fiscal year.

Naija News reported that bandits, on Thursday, attacked the Government Secondary School and LEA primary school in Kuriga, Kaduna State, whisking away no fewer than 280 students, pupils and teachers. It was learned that the assailants reportedly shot at their victims before taking away the students and educators from both schools.

item.title: APC Reacts To Akande's Condemnation Of Caretaker Committee, Membership Revalidation
item.description: The All Progressives Congress (APC) has reiterated that it holds elder stateman and party elder, Chief Bisi Akande as well as Asiwaju Bola Tinubu in high esteem. The party said this in its reaction to the statement by Akande, the pioneer chairman of the APC who on Wednesday faulted the decision to set up a national caretaker committee for the party. He also questioned the decision of the party leadership to call for a re-validation of the party’s membership register less than ten years after the party was initially formed in 2014.

item.title: What Happened to 97.1 Country Legends in Houston?
item.description: Country fans in Houston are confused after 97.1 Country Legends seemed to disappear from the radio, leading some to wonder what happened. The Gist: 97.1 Country Legends, a radio station in Houston, was been replaced by a new station called K-Love that plays Christian music. The change happened as the result of a sale, but Country Legends is still available on the digital frequency 92.9, or you can stream it on their website.

item.title: Appeal Court Rules On Ibezims Disqualification As APC Candidate
item.description: The Appeal Court in Abuja has affirmed the disqualification of Chuwuma Frank Ibezim as the candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in the Imo North Senatorial District by-election. Naija News reports that a three-man panel in a unanimous judgment on Saturday, upheld the December 4, 2020 judgment by Justice Inyang Ekwo of the Federal High Court, Abuja, in the suit filed by Asomugha Tony Eleneke. Recall that the Federal High Court had disqualified Ibezim for making a false claim about his age and educational credentials in the documents submitted to the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC).

Details Of PDP National Caucus Meeting Emerge
item.description: The details of a National Caucus meeting of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Nigeria’s main opposition party have emerged. Naija News reports that the PDP National Caucus held a meeting on Thursday in Abuja, the nation’s capital where various issues concerning the main opposition party were discussed. Parts of the issues raised at the meeting which had in attendance members of the National Working Committee (NWC) of the party, were the review of the 2019 general elections, how to reposition the party ahead of the 2023 general elections, the state of the party, and the recent defection of a governor on its platform,  Governor Dave Umahi of Ebonyi State, southern Nigeria to the All Progressives Congress (APC), Nigeria’s ruling party.

item.title: DSS Invites Sheikh Gumi For Questioning
item.description: The Department of State Security Service (DSS) has invited controversial Islamic cleric Sheikh Abubakar Ahmed Gumi for questioning. According to VOA Hausa, the invitation came after a controversy between Gumi and the Nigerian Army. The SSS spokesman Peter Afunanya had earlier on Friday said it invited the cleric for questioning. “Sheikh Gumi was invited by the Service,” the service’s spokesman, Peter Afunaya, said in a response to a Channels Television enquiry.

According to him, the 39-year-old suspect has been arrested several times and charged in court but he returns to the same crime after getting bail.

item.title: How to file withholding tax returns in Kenya (and current rates)
item.description: The Kenyan Income Tax Act requires every income payer to deduct regular tax from income due for collection by the receivers. All the tax collected is then remitted to the Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) in accordance with the impending state jurisdictions. Learning how to file withholding tax returns in Kenya is beneficial in exercising tax compliance and avoiding unnecessary penalties. Kenya Revenue Authority is an agency of the Government of Kenya that is mandated with the responsibility of assessing, collecting, and accounting for all revenues due to the government, according to the Kenyan laws.

item.description: Barely hours after it was reported that Nigerian terror group, Boko Haram, who kidnapped more than 200 schoolgirls in Chibok, Borno State are seeking a prisoner swap for jailed comrades, the Federal Government of Nigeria have allegedly said that it won't swap Boko Haram prisoners for abducted schoolgirls, according to AFP. item.description: The quiet town of Iwo in Osun State was enveloped in a somber atmosphere as mourners gathered in the Agbowo area, home of the late Sisi Quadri, to partake in the final burial rites of the beloved actor, Quadri Oyebamiji. The entertainment industry was plunged into mourning following the news of Oyebamiji’s demise on Friday, March 1, 2024, with the actor’s passing marking a significant loss to the arts and culture sector in Nigeria.

item.title: The Property Brothers and Hollywood A-Listers Give Back in 'Celebrity IOU' Here's How to Stream
item.description: Here's how to stream 'Celebrity IOU,' the HGTV series where Jonathan and Drew Scott help A-list celebrities give back to deserving loved ones. Source: HGTVIf you're an HGTV junkie who chooses to flip through Architectural Digest over Vogue at your dentist's office, you likely know who Jonathan and Drew Scott are. (You may simply know them as the Property Brothers.) With a slew of shows under their belt — including the OG Property Brothers and Celebrity IOU — the bros are basically the kings of HGTV.

item.title: Final Year AAUA Student Kills Colleague Over IPhone
item.description: An arrest has been made in connection with the suspected murder of a student of Adekunle Ajasin University Akungba (AAUA), Adekunle Adebisi Ifeoluwa. A 21-year-old final-year student of AAUA, Olubodun Sanni, was arrested by the Ondo state police command. Miss Adekunle, a 300-level student in the Department of Economics, was discovered dead on February 2, 2024, inside the one-room apartment she rented outside the university. Speaking while presenting a few suspects,  the commissioner of Ondo Police Command, Abayomi Peter Oladipo, stated that the police found the deceased phone missing after the incident.

item.title: Kaduna State Govt Relaxes Curfew By 12 Hours
item.description: The Kaduna State Government on Monday relaxed by 12 hours, the 24-hour curfew imposed on the state following Sunday’s bombing of three churches in Zaria and Kaduna. The curfew will now take effect from 6 p.m. to 6 a.m. Commissioner for Information Saidu Adamu made the announcement on Monday in Kaduna while speaking to reporters after the State Security Council meeting. The News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) reports that the state government had imposed the curfew following a violent protest that erupted in Kaduna after the attacks.

item.title: Peter Obi Eyes PDP Consensus Presidential Candidate
item.description: A former Anambra Governor, Peter Obi has stated that he might emerge as the consensus presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP). Speaking after receiving the PDP expression of interest and nomination forms presented to him by a group, the presidential hopeful expressed optimism that the main opposition party will present the best candidate to rescue Nigeria. According to him, emphasis is on who is best suited for the job because of the huge problems facing the country.

item.description: The presidency has announced that two separate interviews with President Muhammadu Buhari will hit the airwaves on Wednesday and Thursday. A statement made available to Naija News on Wednesday morning which was signed by the special adviser to the president on media and publicity, Mr. Femi Adesina urged Nigerians to please watch. According to the statement, one interview will hold by 7 pm on Wednesday 5th January while the second interview will hold on Thursday, 6th January by 8 pm.

item.title: Ex-minister Reveals How PDP Can Defeat APC
item.description: A former Transportation Minister, Ebenezer Babatope has revealed how the opposition Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) can take over power from the All Progressives Congress in the 2023 presidential election. Speaking ahead of PDP’s May 28 presidential primary election, the party chieftain warned against actions capable of truncating its chances in 2023. Babatope urged party stakeholders and aspirants to ensure that the presidential primary is fair and credible. The former minister in a statement handed to newsmen on Thursday said PDP’s primary must be such that would lead to the emergence of the best candidate as the flagbearer.

He suffered permanent brain injuries.Terrel has frequently expressed his concern for Prichard's health.

But the film quickly became a cultural touchstone, beloved by audiences and critics alike. The catchphrase “Wakanda Forever” was everywhere and the stars of the movie were catapulted to international superstardom because of the film's massive success.

item.title: You Can Use Most of Your Xbox One Accessories With the Xbox Series X
item.description: Thankfully, you can use the Xbox One controllers with your new Xbox Series X — and they're fairly easy to pair. Here's our how-to guide. Source: Xbox via InstagramSo, you've managed to get your hands on the new (and still hard to find) Xbox Series X — congrats! The new console boasts a framerate of 120fps as well as Quick Resume, which allows players to suspend multiple games at once and pick them up as desired.

item.title: 'Murphy Brown' Actor Charles Kimbrough Has Died at 86
item.description: Actor Charles Kimbrough, best known for his work in 'Murphy Brown,' has died at age 86. What was his cause of death? Here's what we know. Source: Getty ImagesTony- and Emmy-nominated actor Charles Kimbrough, best known for his portrayal of newsman Jim Dial on the CBS hit Murphy Brown, died on Jan. 11, 2023, at the age of 86. The actor, whose death was first reported by The New York Times, was nominated for Best Supporting Actor at the Emmys for portraying Jim Dial in 1990, and he later reprised his role in the 2018 Murphy Brown reboot for three episodes.

item.title: Nigeria At 61: APC Govt Has Made Life Difficult For Nigerians
item.description: Ahead of Nigeria’s 61st independence anniversary, the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has accused the All Progressives Congress (APC) government of making life difficult for Nigerians in the past six years. The PDP National Publicity Secretary, Kola Ologbondiyan, made the accusation while addressing newsmen at the party’s national headquarters on Thursday. He described the six years of President Buhari administration as the worst in Nigeria’s history as an independent, sovereign state.

item.title: Police kills notorious kidnapper - Legit.ng
item.description: A notorious kidnapper in Imo state has been shot dead by a brave policeman of the state's police command. The kidnapper known as Samuel was killed on Thursday at about 6pm at his hideout in a hotel in Owerri, the state's capital. According to police officer who pleaded anonymity, Samuel had been declared wanted by the police in Abuja before he met his death in Owerri. Samuel was said to have led a team of abductors in Lagos to kidnap a wealthy businessman and had demanded an initial ransom of N20 million.

item.title: Teachers Service Commission transfers 3,094 primary,secondary school heads
item.description: - The massive transfers are as a result of some teachers attaining mandatory retirement age - TSC explained some deputy heads who have exemplary performance records have been promoted - The teachers' employer pegged mandatory retirement age at 60 but one may opt to retire earlier Teachers Service Commission (TSC) has given 3,094 primary and secondary head teachers until December 28 to hand over status report following massive transfer on Tuesday, December 18.

item.title: Wasiu Alabi Pasumas biography: age, net worth, house, children

Some fans call him Oganla, Gauzu Fuji, and Ijoba Fuji. He is among the most successful Fuji musicians in west Africa.

item.title: Obasanjo Hosts Secondus Amid PDP Crisis
item.description: Former President of Nigeria, Olusegun Obasanjo, on Thursday, hosted the National Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party, Uche Secondus in Abeokuta, the Ogun State capital. It was gathered that the embattled chairman of the main opposition party arrived at the Penthouse of the Olusegun Obasanjo Presidential Library (OOPL) around 12:19 pm alongside other party leaders. A further report had it that Secondus after his arrival went into a closed-door meeting with the elder statesman.

item.title: SEast Group Berates Pate Over Appointments In Health Ministry
item.description: South East Dynamic Youths, a southeast group, has attacked the coordinating Minister of Health, Ali Pate, over recent appointments within the Ministry. In a statement on Tuesday, the group’s coordinator, Tony Obiogbolu, alleged that the minister failed to include south-easterners in his recent appointments. Naija News reports that Obiogbolu called on President Bola Tinubu to prevail on the health minister and address the alleged lopsided appointments. It claimed that despite having qualified candidates in every area where appointments were made, Pate purposefully left out individuals from the South East in his most recent selections.

item.title: JUST IN: Judiciary Workers Suspend Strike
item.description: The Judiciary Staff Union of Nigeria has announced the suspension of its strike action. Nailja News reports that the union made this known in a communique released on Wednesday, June 9. The communique which contained the signature of Emmanuel Abioye, Deputy President of the union and Isaiah Adetola, the General Secretary, revealed that all staff will resume work on Monday. Naija News understands that the strike was called off by the union after its emergency National Executive Council meeting held earlier today.

item.title: Kenyas public debt doubles that of Tanzania, 5 times more than Ugandas
item.description: - Uganda's external and internal debt combined was five times lower compared to Kenya's - The country may borrow more to finance development agenda owing to stagnant tax revenue - Tanzania's debt was about half that of Kenya which staggered at KSh 5.1 trillion - Kenya's total public debt is expected to rise by KSh 2 trillion in the next four years - Tanzania's debt is also expected to grow as government continues to borrow to finance infrastructure projects

item.title: Bode George Speaks On Rift With Tinubu

The PDP chieftain said the wealth, properties and other assets owned by the former Governor of Lagos State were all a “bundle of lies”.

item.title: Court Grants Sunday Igbohos Aides Bail After 32 Days In DSS
item.description: A Federal High Court, Abuja has granted bail to 12 aides of Yoruba Nation agitator, Sunday Igboho, after spending 32 days in the detention of the Department of State Services. Justice Obiora Egwuatu admitted their bail in a bail application, filed on their behalf by lawyer Pelumi Olajengbesi. The judge rejected the plea by DSS lawyer, Idowu Awo, that some of the detainees will flee the country as their leader, Sunday Igboho, did if granted bail.

item.title: Daniel Webster (Politician) - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Loquacious politician who represented Massachusetts in both the House of Representatives and the Senate. He was appointed the United States Secretary of State under three presidents. Before Fame He worked as a lawyer and teacher after attending Dartmouth College. Trivia He was part of the Great Triumvirate along with Henry Clay and John C. Calhoun. Family Life His father, Ebenzer Webster, served as a judge, militia man, and farmer. Associated With In 1839, he was offered the position as Vice-President to President William Henry Harrison, but turned it down.

item.title: Everything You Need to Know About Playing 'Minecraft' in VR
item.description: Mojang has added official VR support to 'Minecraft'. Here’s how to play 'Minecraft' in VR, whether you own the Bedrock or Java edition. Source: MojangDespite launching more than a decade ago, Minecraft shows absolutely no signs of slowing down. The massive open-world adventure game continues to see constant updates, and it’s now playable on just about every platform under the sun. In fact, Mojang has even managed to add VR support, letting you don a headset and dive deeper into Minecraft’s blocky world.

item.title: Henry, Shearer Inducted Into Premier League Hall Of Fame
item.description: Thierry Henry and Alan Shearer were on Monday named as the first players inducted into the official Premier League Hall of Fame in recognition of a combined 435 goals and seven Golden Boot awards. Arsenal’s all-time top scorer Henry won two Premier League titles under Arsene Wenger and was part of the “Invincibles” team that went unbeaten throughout the 2003/04 title-winning campaign. France’s record goalscorer and 1998 World Cup winner scored more than 20 Premier League goals in five consecutive seasons between 2001/02 and 2005/06.

item.title: How Far Does Nayte Olukoya Make It on 'The Bachelorette'? (SPOILERS)
item.description: How Far Does Nayte Olukoya Make It on 'The Bachelorette'? (SPOILERS)By Katherine StinsonPublished Nov. 2 2021, 7:05 p.m. ET Source: ABC/Instagram Spoiler alert: This article contains potential spoilers for Season 18 of The Bachelorette. Just how far does Nayte Olukoya go on Season 18 of The Bachelorette? The 27-year-old Indeed.com sales executive from Austin, Texas, has already made a strong impression with the Season 18 Bachelorette lead Michelle Young. Although Nayte didn't get the coveted first one-on-one date with Michelle, he did get the first impression rose.

item.title: Jasmine Jordan - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Best known as the daughter of basketball star Michael Jordan. She gained a substantial following on Instagram with over 170,000 followers. Before Fame She graduated from Syracuse University with a degree in sports management. Trivia She was featured in an August 2020 article on the online publication Charlotte Magazine.  Family Life Her siblings include Jeffrey, Marcus, Victoria, and Isabel Jordan. In June 2018, she got engaged to basketball player Rakeem Christmas. In summer 2019, they gave birth to a son.

item.title: Jerry Hall - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Former model and actress best known for her high-profile and several decade-long relationship with Rolling Stones frontman Mick Jagger. Before Fame She was discovered sunbathing at a hostel in the French Riviera by modeling agent Claude Haddad. Trivia She has a twin sister named Terry and she appeared in Batman in 1989. Family Life She married Mick Jagger in 1977 in an unofficial ceremony. The couple had four children named Georgia, Elizabeth, Gabriel and James.

item.description: Film and stage performer who won both an Oscar and a Golden Globe for her role as Pilar in the 1943 film For Whom the Bell Tolls. item.title: Kiddwaya Can't afford Me - Wathoni Roars
item.description: Former BBNaija Housemate, Wathoni has made it clear that Kiddwaya can’t afford her. The lockdown housemate made this known during her session with Ebuka where she talked about the issues she had with Erica because of Kidd . Erica said: “Wathoni had always had an issue with me right from the house. After the house I noticed she kept talking about Kidd and I in bed rather than promoting herself. “That made me distance myself from her and I got energy vibes from her and stayed away.

item.title: Machakos Court Okays DNA Test of Child in Dispute Between Married Woman and Male Workmate
item.description: Two workmates from the Kenya Bureau of Standards have been fighting over the paternity of a six-year-old childThe mother of the child, who is a married woman, had challenged a ruling that gave her male colleague the nod to conduct a DNA testJustice Odunga dismissed her appeal and okayed the paternity test saying the man had reasonable grounds to ask for the DNAPAY ATTENTION: Help us change more lives, join TUKO.

item.title: Moi University VC protest prove ethnic appointments
item.description: - Politicians stormed Moi University after Education CS Fred Matiang’i appointed Laban Ayiro as the acting VC - Governor Mandago said the appointment of Laban Ayiro was wrong because he is non-Kalenjin - Several public universities are being headed by VC's from dominant ethnic tribes where university is located The move made by two governors and politicians who led residents to storm Moi University protesting the appointment of the new Vice-Chancellor (VC) has raised eyebrows.

item.title: Pablo Core - Age, Family, Bio
PDP Woos APC Presidential Aspirant With Gov'ship Ticket
item.description: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) is making a move to lure a former presidential aspirant of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Nicholas Felix to the party. The main opposition party has the agenda of presenting Felix with the Edo State governorship ticket of the party in 2024 if he joins the party. This is coming months after Felix claimed that the presidential candidate of the APC, Bola Tinubu, did not reach out to him because he supported the vice president, Yemi Osinbajo, during the presidential primary of the ruling party.

item.title: Scores Killed As NAF Airstrikes Hit Terrorists In Kaduna
item.description: In a statement released in Abuja on Sunday, the Director of Public Relations and Information for the Nigerian Air Force (NAF), Air Commodore Edward Gabkwet, announced that a significant number of terrorist elements were neutralized in Tsauni Doka, located in the Igabi Local Government Area of Kaduna State. Naija News understands that the NAF component of Operation Whirl Punch carried out the successful air interdiction mission. Gabkwet said the decision to conduct the strikes was based on credible intelligence that revealed the presence of a notorious terrorist leader named Boderi and his followers in Tsauni Doka.

item.title: South-West Govs In Closed-Door Meeting Ahead Of Atiku's Visit
item.description: Governor of Oyo State, Seyi Makinde and his counterparts in the South-West are reportedly in a closed-door meeting ahead of Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) presidential candidate, Atiku Abubakar‘s visit to the region this week. Naija News understands that Atiku is expected to be in Lagos State on Tuesday, September 13, 2022, at the Commerce House, 1 Idowu Taylor Street, Victoria Island to speak at the event titled: “Private Sector Economic Forum’ ahead of the 2023 presidential election.

item.title: Top Nigerian Newspaper Headlines For Today, Saturday, 21st May, 2022
item.description: Good morning Nigeria, welcome to Naija News roundup of top newspaper headlines in Nigeria for today Saturday, 21st May 2022. The Governor of Kaduna State, Nasir El-Rufai must have sent shivers down the spine of concerned Nigerians when he disclosed on Wednesday that “the problem of insecurity now has moved from the North-East to the North-West” as he decried the emergence of Boko Haram elements and terrorists’ enclave in parts of his state.

item.title: Uhuru asisimua Wakenya baada ya kunywa Senator Keg (picha)
item.description: -Wananchi watumiao mitandao ya kijamii wanaendelea kufurahishwa na picha ya Rais Uhuru Kenyatta akishiriki mvinyo wa Keg -Picha hizo zilizopigwa Jumatano Julai 12 2017 wakati wa ziara yake Kisumu zimesambazwa kwa wingi mitandaoni -Uhuru alikuwa Kisumu kuzindua utengenezaji kiwanda cha kutengenezea pombe cha kampuni ya EABL cha gharama ya KSh 15 bilioni -Uhuru pia alizindua barabara ya kilomita 84 kutoka Ahero kuelekea Kisii na barabara zingine ndogo eneo hilo zitazowekwa lami kwa gharama ya KShs9.

item.title: Victor Osimhen Not Yet Cleared To Play Against South Africa
item.description: The media officer of the Super Eagles of Nigeria, Babafemi Raji, has debunked speculations that Victor Osimhen has been cleared to play against South Africa on Wednesday, February 7. Earlier on Monday, most football enthusiasts from Nigeria were devastated to hear that Victor Osimhen is battling with abdominal discomfort. Due to illness, Osimhen didn’t fly with the rest of the Super Eagles of Nigeria from Abidjan to Bouaké on Monday night which sparked speculations that he might not be fit for the 2023 AFCON semi-final match against Bafana Bafana.

item.title: Why Are the Dodgers Called the Dodgers? The MLB Franchise Has Quite the History
item.description: Why are the Los Angeles Dodgers called the Dodgers? The legendary MLB franchise has quite the history — here's what we know about its name origins. Source: Twitter / @DodgersWith the 2022 MLB season in full swing, we have to admit — the Los Angeles Dodgers are already having quite the year. As of now, the legendary baseball franchise is leading the National League West with 21 wins and 12 losses .
